intro: Homanthis pinnatifidus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed homanthis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has palmate leaves that are finely divided. Its botanical features include a hairy stem and small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds.
